video.title: Wounded: The Battle Back Home
video.synopsis: This generation's injured veterans battle the visible and invisible wounds of war and navigate their post-war lives through challenges and triumphs.

episodes.synopsis: Shane Kitchen is suicidal after seeing 19 friends die in Iraq, but an outreach coordinator helps him honor his losses as a martial arts fighting pro.
episodes.title: Shane

episodes.synopsis: Angie Peacock turns to drugs and attempts suicide when she returns from Iraq, but a dog named G.I Joe and a peer group help her face her fears.
episodes.title: Angie

episodes.synopsis: Bill Hansen endures battle with a broken back and brain injury, but back home, the Wounded Warriors Project helps him heal and win his private war.
episodes.title: Big Sarge

episodes.synopsis: The parents of a severely injured soldier use their heartbreak to push Congress to pass the Caregiver Act, allowing the VA to help family caregivers.
episodes.title: Jason

episodes.synopsis: A traumatic brain injury sends Paul de la Cerda home a changed man, but bonding with others though music helps him and others combat their struggles.
episodes.title: Paul

episodes.synopsis: Keith and Chris push through barriers at a camp for adaptive sports, demonstrating how friendship and activity can heal physical and emotional wounds.
episodes.title: Keith & Chris

episodes.synopsis: Robert "Nico" Gil rediscovers his life's meaning by connecting to fly fishing and to other suffering veterans, lifting him from despair to hope.
episodes.title: Nico

episodes.synopsis: John Usener recounts the combat events that led to his PTSD and TBI, and shares the new passion he discovered through the Wounded Warrior Project.
episodes.title: John

episodes.synopsis: A traumatic brain injury from an explosion lands Dennis Cabanting in an old folks home at age 36. With the help of others, he begins a new life.
episodes.title: Dennis

episodes.synopsis: Jessica confronts demons from her sexual assault and files a claim with the VA, which comes back denied. Yoga, which she now teaches, saves her life.
episodes.title: Jessica

episodes.synopsis: Jesse Bergeron sees a fellow Marine die, then rushes home to be with his critically ill baby. Family and veterans help him overcome grief and guilt.
episodes.title: Jesse

episodes.synopsis: The events of 9/11 prompt Jamel Danies to enlist. In Iraq, he loses a leg and suffers from many residual problems, until he seeks help from his peers.
episodes.title: Jamel
